job_details.Functieomschrijving:
We are looking for an communicative DEV Engineer to strengthen us in Credit Risk. We are looking for engineers who can push us to the next architectural design of our credit risk program. This means thinking about, trying out and applying this new architecture. In this chapter we deal with big data which needs to be validated, processed (apply calculations) and loaded into systems for further processing.
       Who are we?
       COO Risk and Finance delivers baseline and change activities for both Risk and Finance. Our vision and purpose for COO Risk and Finance is clear: To deliver best in class data, insights and advice which empower our consumers to control, explain, predict and optimise the performance of ING. We play a critical role at ING and will be the go-to function for all kinds of data across the Bank.
       Your main focus
          + Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines.
          + Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications.
          + Improving stability, performance, and reliability of the Credit Risk applications.
          + Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product.
          + A bank is based on trust of their customers. Therefore, your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards.
          + Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
          + Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process.
          + Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring.
       In addition to developing software solutions, you will contribute to:
          + We expect you to share and teach your knowledge to other team members as well.
          + Optimization of the service stability and continuity.
          + Help Credit Risk to make big steps to the future. Enhance the CI/CD maturity, move to a containerized environment, prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.
          + In short, we expect you to have or help us have a vision on how to provide our services in the future.
       Your work environment
       You will work in the TECH organization of COO Risk and Finance. You will be part of the Vortex team delivering IT solutions and services for the Credit Risk Tribe. The Vortex teams operate according to the Scrum Agile development process. The focus is on high-quality secure-critical software delivered in time. The key development technology used in your squad are Java, Oracle 19, Linux, and Kafka. The Azure DevOps is the single solution used for version control, build, release etc.
job_details.full_text:
Dev Engineer Java

We are looking for an communicative DEV Engineer to strengthen us in Credit Risk. We are looking for engineers who can push us to the next architectural design of our credit risk program. This means thinking about, trying out and applying this new architecture. In this chapter we deal with big data which needs to be validated, processed (apply calculations) and loaded into systems for further processing.
       Who are we?
       COO Risk and Finance delivers baseline and change activities for both Risk and Finance. Our vision and purpose for COO Risk and Finance is clear: To deliver best in class data, insights and advice which empower our consumers to control, explain, predict and optimise the performance of ING. We play a critical role at ING and will be the go-to function for all kinds of data across the Bank.
       Your main focus
          + Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines.
          + Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications.
          + Improving stability, performance, and reliability of the Credit Risk applications.
          + Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product.
          + A bank is based on trust of their customers. Therefore, your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards.
          + Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery.
          + Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process.
          + Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring.
       In addition to developing software solutions, you will contribute to:
          + We expect you to share and teach your knowledge to other team members as well.
          + Optimization of the service stability and continuity.
          + Help Credit Risk to make big steps to the future. Enhance the CI/CD maturity, move to a containerized environment, prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.
          + In short, we expect you to have or help us have a vision on how to provide our services in the future.
       Your work environment
       You will work in the TECH organization of COO Risk and Finance. You will be part of the Vortex team delivering IT solutions and services for the Credit Risk Tribe. The Vortex teams operate according to the Scrum Agile development process. The focus is on high-quality secure-critical software delivered in time. The key development technology used in your squad are Java, Oracle 19, Linux, and Kafka. The Azure DevOps is the single solution used for version control, build, release etc.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional software development, data engineering (ETL, data processing), and MLOps principles within a banking context (Credit Risk). While it mentions 'big data' and 'calculations', there is no mention of machine learning, generative AI, predictive modeling, or specific AI/ML frameworks or models. The core responsibilities and technologies (Java, Oracle, Linux, Kafka, Azure DevOps) point towards a senior software/data engineer role rather than an ML or GenAI Engineer. Therefore, it falls under the 'Ambiguous' category as it's a technical role but not specifically AI/ML or GenAI focused.

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'deal with big data which needs to be validated, processed (apply calculations) and loaded into systems for further processing' and 'Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines' directly relate to data processing, validation, and pipeline building.
job_tasks.phrase: deal with big data which needs to be validated, processed (apply calculations) and loaded into systems for further processing

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines' describes the core activities of data engineering, specifically building and maintaining data pipelines and processing logic.
job_tasks.phrase: Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications' implies building and integrating systems, a core software development activity.
job_tasks.phrase: Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Improving stability, performance, and reliability of the Credit Risk applications' is a common responsibility in software development, focusing on the quality and maintainability of applications.
job_tasks.phrase: Improving stability, performance, and reliability of the Credit Risk applications

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product' indicates end-to-end responsibility for software, including its lifecycle management, which aligns with MLOps principles.
job_tasks.phrase: Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards' highlights the importance of secure software development practices.
job_tasks.phrase: your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery' is a direct description of MLOps practices.
job_tasks.phrase: Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process' describes the automation of testing within the software development lifecycle, a key MLOps component.
job_tasks.phrase: Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring' directly relates to monitoring and observability in production systems, a core MLOps function.
job_tasks.phrase: Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'share and teach your knowledge to other team members as well' indicates a need for knowledge sharing and mentoring, which falls under communication and collaboration.
job_tasks.phrase: share and teach your knowledge to other team members as well

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'Enhance the CI/CD maturity' directly refers to improving Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery processes, which are central to MLOps.
The phrase 'move to a containerized environment' refers to adopting containerization technologies like Docker, which is a common practice in MLOps for deployment and management.
The phrase 'prepare for the move to the public cloud' indicates involvement in cloud infrastructure management and deployment strategies, often part of MLOps.
job_tasks.phrase: prepare for the move to the public cloud

job_tasks.justification: The phrase 'have or help us have a vision on how to provide our services in the future' implies strategic thinking and problem-solving for future service delivery.
job_tasks.phrase: have or help us have a vision on how to provide our services in the future
